nodes.bodyText:
I don't think the two operations are doing the same thing, and I read the ankitects/upstream code
The value of 'part' will be different as the iteration happens for size >= 2. In the original implementation it will be like A::B if i == 2, but in your proposal part will be B.
So something different will be added to parents - it will be full of non-fully-pathed deck names instead of fully pathed ones. I don't think that's correct

On "A::B", parts is the array {"A", "B"}. so parts.size() is 2 and parts.size()-1 is 1, so parts.sublist(0, parts.size()-1)) equals parts.sublist(0,1) which is the sublist "{A}"
So the previous loop was only applied once, with part equal to A.
With my loop, i's value is only 0 (since 1 is not less than parts.size()-1). So String take a single value, which is also "A"
In particular, "i" is never equal to "2" in your example

Mmm I think you're right, I think I misread it first attempt. This does exist upstream though
https://github.com/ankitects/anki/blob/8b3f0100e4fc17e4810e3a2134ef728544ca552c/pylib/anki/decks.py#L597-L602
let me re-read

Let me be clear. I am NOT saying that we do the same thing as upstream. I am only saying that I am pretty sure that my pull request does not change what ankidroid does. If we didn't follow upstream, then I'm not correcting this. If we did follow upstream, I'm quite convinced that we are still following it.
I'm trying to change execution time, not behaviour
